answers.author: Caitlyn Mitchell
answers.text:
For cities in Illonois, under the smoke free laws outlined by state legislation. Individual violators pay fines $100 - $250 Business owner fines are no less than $250 on the first violation on the second violation no less than $500
(Within one year of the first violation.) Additional violations: no less than $2500 (Each additional violation within one year.) 
The Illinois Department of Public Health (IDPH), certified local public health departments, and local law enforcement have all been designated as the enforcers of this law. 
So far unexpected obstacles have stemmed from multiple interpretations of the state wide smoke free laws and the general task associated with enforcing the laws. One common loophole is designating an "exit only" door, since the law requires smokers mover so many feet away from enterances. The other main issue is building cooperation in enforcing the laws. Manager do not want to report ther employees because it could result in fines for the office as well as the offender.

author: Tracy Miller
text:
A Florida member government would like to know if your government has your local government implemented tobacco-free campuses/properties? For those who have such policies, how is enforcement handled? What are the consequences to violators? What were the unexpected obstacles to implementation?   
Please respond here or directly to tmiller@transformgov.org.  Thank you.  
Tracy Miller  
Florida Regional Director  
Alliance for Innovation
title: Tobacco-Free Campus
